security_audit.summary: This skill is purely documentation-based with no executable code, scripts, or network capabilities. All 52 static findings are false positives caused by misinterpreting TypeScript type definitions as cryptographic code, documentation file paths as system reconnaissance, and template literal syntax as shell execution. The skill provides only guidance for working with TypeScript types and DSL processing.

content.user_title: Develop Figram core DSL processing package
content.value_statement: The Figram core package requires careful coordination across types, validation, normalization, and diff logic. This skill provides a structured workflow for extending DSL processing with type safety and consistent data flow patterns.
actual_capabilities: Define and extend TypeScript types for DSL and IR representations
Implement validation rules for YAML DSL input
Build normalization logic for DSL to IR conversion
Create diff algorithms for incremental patch generation
Add and run co-located tests with bun:test
Follow data flow: DSL â†’ validate â†’ normalize â†’ IR â†’ diff â†’ Patch
limitations: No built-in code generation for target languages
Does not include runtime interpretation of DSL
No native diagram rendering or visualization

use_cases.title: Extend core package types
use_cases.description: Add new node or edge properties to the DSL with proper validation and normalization support.

use_cases.title: Fix validation bugs
use_cases.description: Diagnose and fix edge cases in YAML validation that cause incorrect error messages.

use_cases.title: Add patch operations
use_cases.description: Implement new patch operation types for enhanced synchronization between CLI and FigJam plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Add node property
prompt_templates.scenario: Extending DSL with new node fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new 'color' property to DSLNode and IRNode in types.ts. Then update validate.ts to ensure color is a valid hex string, normalize.ts to set a default value, and diff.ts to handle color changes in equality checks.

prompt_templates.title: Add validation rule
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a validation rule in validate.ts that ensures all node IDs in the nodes array are unique within the document. Add a test case for duplicate ID detection.

prompt_templates.title: Debug diff output
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the diff.ts implementation. When comparing two IRDocuments where only node labels changed, explain how the diff algorithm determines which nodes need upsertNode vs removeNode+upsertNode operations.

prompt_templates.title: Update WebSocket protocol
prompt_templates.scenario: Extending communication between CLI and plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new 'sync' message type to the WebSocket protocol for requesting partial document synchronization. Update the appropriate interfaces in types.ts and document the expected message flow.

output_examples.input: Add a 'healthCheck' property to nodes that can be 'healthy', 'warning', or 'critical'
output: Added DSLNode.healthCheck and IRNode.healthCheck to types.ts
Updated validate.ts: healthCheck must be one of ['healthy', 'warning', 'critical']
Updated normalize.ts: default healthCheck to 'healthy' when undefined
Updated diff.ts: nodes with same ID but different healthCheck trigger upsertNode
Added tests in validate.test.ts for valid/invalid healthCheck values
Added tests in normalize.test.ts for default value handling

best_practices: Keep types, validation, normalization, and diff logic synchronized when adding new properties
Add test cases for validation errors, normalization defaults, and diff edge cases
Follow the documented data flow to trace issues through the processing pipeline
anti_patterns: Adding properties to IR without corresponding DSL types and normalization logic
Skipping validation when adding new fields, leading to runtime errors
Modifying diff logic without updating equality checks in normalization

faq.question: What file handles YAML validation?
faq.answer: validate.ts in packages/core/src/ contains all validation logic for DSL input with descriptive error messages.

faq.question: How are new properties added to the DSL?
faq.answer: Update types.ts, validate.ts, normalize.ts, and diff.ts in sequence. Add tests for each layer.

faq.question: What generates incremental updates?
faq.answer: diff.ts calculates the difference between two IRDocuments and produces Patch operations for efficient updates.

faq.question: Is data safe to process?
faq.answer: Yes. The core package is dependency-free and processes data in memory without network access or file system writes.

faq.question: How are test failures diagnosed?
faq.answer: Run bun test packages/core/ to see which layer fails. Trace through the data flow to identify the source issue.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DSL tools?
faq.answer: Figram focuses specifically on architecture diagrams with a minimal, type-safe pipeline for YAML to FigJam conversion.
